alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 7:14PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SCHUYLKILL COUNTY... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 713 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Hazleton to near Minersville and moving east at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Tamaqua and Hometown around 720 PM EST. Seltzer around 730 PM EST. Pottsville, St. Clair and Mechanicsville around 735 PM EST. Schuylkill Haven, Renningers and Port Carbon around 740 PM EST. Orwigsburg around 745 PM EST. McKeansburg around 755 PM EST. This includes Interstate 81 between mile markers 100 and 112, and from mile markers 125 to 137. This includes the following highways... Route 209 near Tower City, and from Muir to Coaldale. State Road 61 from north of Pottsville to Port Clinton. State Road 309 from south of McAdoo to near Snyders. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
